definitions.definition: To make corrupt ; to change from good to bad; to draw away from the right path; to deprave ; to pervert .
examples: Don't you dare corrupt my son with those disgusting pictures!

definitions.definition: To become putrid , tainted, or otherwise impure ; to putrefy ; to rot .
To introduce errors ; to place into an invalid state .
examples: Unplugging a flash drive without dismounting it first can corrupt the data stored on the drive.

definitions.definition: To debase or make impure by alterations or additions; to falsify.
examples: to corrupt language, or a holy text

definitions.definition: To waste, spoil, or consume; to make worthless.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To make corrupt ; to change from good to bad; to draw away from the right path; to deprave ; to pervert .
secondary_definitions: ( archaic , intransitive ) To become putrid , tainted, or otherwise impure ; to putrefy ; to rot .
( transitive ) To introduce errors ; to place into an invalid state .
To debase or make impure by alterations or additions; to falsify.
To waste, spoil, or consume; to make worthless.
